item.title: Santa Cruz river dams (Patagonia Argentina)
item.description:
Project duration: 72 months

BID Amount: $4.8 billion

The project consists in two hydropower dams along the Santa Cruz river and is the largest infrastructure project in Argentina nowadays. The install capacity will be 1,310 MW, with an average annual plant generation of 5,100 GWh.

Condo Cliff dam
Install capacity: 950 MW
Annual generation: 3270 GWh
Turbomachines: 5 Francis
Dam type: Concrete face rockfill dam (CFRD)
Dam height: 240 ft (73 meters)
Dam lenght: 6,562 ft (2,000 meters)

La Barrancosa dam
Install capacity: 360 MW
Annual generation: 1900 GWh
Turbomachines: 3 Kaplan
Dam type: Concrete face rockfill dam (CFRD)
Dam height: 135 ft (41 meters)
Dam lenght: 8,022 ft (2,445 meters)

item.title: El Tambolar Dam (San Juan, Argentina)
item.description:
BID Amount: $750 million

The project consists in a multi purpose dam on the San Juan river, Argentina, and will be the fourth dam built along the river.

Install capacity: 78 MW
Annual generation: 346.5 GWh
Turbomachines: 2 Francis
Dam type: Concrete face rockfill dam (CFRD)
Dam height: 272 ft (83 meters)
Dam lenght: 370 ft (113 meters)
Reservoir capacity = 490,482 acre-ft (605 Hm3)
Spilway discharge capacity = 162,448 cu ft/s (4600 m3/s)

item.title: Portezuelo del Viento Dam (Mendoza, Argentina)
item.description:
Project duration: 5 years

BID Amount: $ 720 million

Install capacity: 210 MW
Annual generation: 884 GWh
Turbomachines: 3 Francis
Dam type: roller-compacted concrete (RCC)
Dam height: 607 ft (185 meters)
Reservoir capacity = 1,621,426 acre-ft (2000 Hm3)
Spilway discharge capacity = 56,503 cu ft/s (1600 m3/s)
